name: Pacific Ocean
fun_fact: The Pacific Ocean is home to the Mariana Trench, the deepest point on Earth.
climate: Tropical, subtropical, temperate, and polar climates
currents: Kuroshio Current, California Current, East Australian Current
ecosystems: Coral reefs, kelp forests, deep-sea vents

name: Atlantic Ocean
fun_fact: The Gulf Stream, a powerful warm current, flows through the Atlantic Ocean.
climate: Tropical, subtropical, temperate, and polar climates
currents: Gulf Stream, North Atlantic Current, South Atlantic Current
ecosystems: Coral reefs, kelp forests, deep-sea vents

name: Indian Ocean
fun_fact: The Indian Ocean has the warmest surface temperatures of all oceans.
climate: Tropical, subtropical, temperate, and polar climates
currents: Indian Monsoon Current, Agulhas Current, Somali Current
ecosystems: Coral reefs, Seagrass meadows, Mangroves along coastal areas

name: Southern Ocean
fun_fact: The Southern Ocean is the only ocean that circles the Earth entirely, surrounding Antarctica.
climate: Extremely cold,  low temperatures ,  icy winds
ecosystems: Ice-based ecosystems, Open-ocean ecosystems supporting krill and whales, Seafloor ecosystems with unique species like icefish

name: Arctic  Ocean
fun_fact: The Arctic Ocean is almost entirely covered by ice in winter, but its ice is rapidly melting due to climate change.
ecosystems: Sea ice ecosystems,Open-water ecosystems during summer melt, Seafloor ecosystems with benthic species
